title: Frieze, 1825–35
provenance: From the early 1800s to the mid-1970s this paper hung in the parlor at Locust Thicket in Lynchburg, Virginia. See object file for information on the house.
creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Hugh B. Jackson
description: Fans of feathers emerging behind sunburst of jewels, over which are draped swags rendered in flock; this bound by a string of pearls and emeralds. Swags are caught up with jewelled medallion from which is pendant a giant pearl, and over this, a cluster of jewels. Tassels hang below this. Along the edge, egg and dart banding.  On the verso, an imprint of a simple striped pattern with sprigs in widely-spaced grid, the paper hung with this frieze.

tombstone.epitaph:
Frieze, 1825–35.
1825–35. Block-printed and flocked on paper. Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Hugh B. Jackson. 1973-10-1.
